CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 17, 1959, pg. 8 reads: "Men - Success in marine Corps means you are a "man" and Pvt. George Johnson, son of Mrs. Grace Johnson, of 2521 Wylie Ave. is well on his way. After completing the rugged 12 weeks of recruit training at Parris Island, S.C., Johnson headed for advance training at Camp Lejeune, N.C., found he had put on muscles equal to the weight of the bag in Marine Sgt. Grubb's hand, and had grown two inches from the level indicated by Sgt. Ivan Vlach. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Marines Sergeant Ivan Vlach, Private George Johnson, and Sergeant Grubb holding bag marked "24 lbs," standing in interior with U.S. Marine Corps plaque and banner
